data.title: All around amazing!
data.text: The food is so good at tierneys!  They also have great happy hour prices and daily drink specials! Live music Friday and Saturday nights!  Must come by!

data.title: Our Lunch was Terrific!
data.text: We went here for lunch yesterday for the first time and were very happy with the food, drinks, and service.  The menu is extensive and offers many down home offerings.  The breakfast menu is terrific and their pies are awesome.  I would definitely go back to try other items, and I would recommend this location to anyone hosting out of town guests.

data.title: Great local restaurant
data.text: Jalapeño catfish is excellent, and the famous potato chip chicken. Dog friendly patio with happy hour once a month on a weekend.

data.title: VERY BEST GO TO PLACE IN LEWISVILLE TEXAS
data.text:
Very nice and clean family environment!
Good food, good company and great time!

Sit inside or out....alone or in a group....every one fits in.

Try the tasty deep fried cat fish....made to perfection!  Great mashed potatoes and gravy...add some fried okra sit back to enjoy!

data.title: Excellent value and good food
data.text: I live in Plano and my brother lives in Trophy Club, TX.  My niece is in town for the weekend from NYC.  We needed a place between our locals for breakfast today.  We agreed to meet in Lewisville.  My wife used Trip Advisor and settled on Tierney's Cafe and Tavern due to its high Trip Advisor rating.  We agreed to meet at 9:30 am.  Thankfully the weather was beautiful and waiting 30 minutes for the cafe to open (at 10 am) was pleasant.  Probably good anyway as the establishment was crowded with at least 6 groups lined up at the door for the opening.  We were seated right away and were told about the Sunday Buffet.  I viewed the offerings and was very impressed at the size and appetizing quality of the offerings.  I, however, prefer to be served meals and opted for the Californian Benedict off the menu.  My 3 dining companions chose the buffet.  All three agreed that the food was tasty and that for $14.95, a tremendous value.  My brother had 3 separate platefuls of food.  My wife had 2 and a desert offering.  I tasted the prime rib off her plate and it was excellent.  As for my Benedict, it was very slow to arrive, but I didn't mind.  It was adequate (good but I've had better at other places in the past).  My wife's comment was that the buffet did not have signs/labels of the offerings which would have been nice but she enjoyed.  My brother, who eats every meal at a restaurant (I know that is crazy), said, he will include this place on his list of establishments to return to again and again.  I would gladly eat there again if in the area.  I give this place the best rating of 5 circles!  Very good breakfast food and excellent value.  Thank you Trip Advisor!!!!

data.title: WWII 103 Division Reunion
data.text: Fabulous meal, great service. Our waitress Maschelle was amazing. If in Lewisville you must visit. The chicken fried steak, potato chip chicken we're yummie.  Excellent country green beans.

data.title: Popular
data.text: This place seems to be popular with the local residents. Maybe because of the live bands or musicians? Definitely not because of the food. We ate here for dinner and the presentation and taste of the food was less than desirable. I've heard that the breakfast is better than dinner. The restaurant was once an old house and you can definitely tell because renovations were minimal. The place smell like old dust and mold.

data.title: Southern prim rib
data.text:
Southern prime rib?  Well I've never been in a restaurant that serves prime rib with things like fried okra or collard greens as side dish choices.  Life is good!

We have made Tierney's our go to place for prime rib.  The service is consistently good and friendly.  The prime rib is done excellent and always as you ordered.  Did I mention the sides selection?  We have had a few other choices from the menu which is well thought out and the selections are fresh and done right.

They only do prime rib on Saturday evening and only until it runs out.  We advise an early dinner date to avoid a let down.  Plus if you get there later in the evening the live entertainment will be kicking in and it will be LOUD.  Back in the day when I was a rock and roll joint bartender and manager I found many entertainers appear to substitute volume for talent.  They do have a “back room” but the walls are not sound proofed.

If you're into loud music and loud crowd a late night meal just might be your ticket.  I think I might have used up that preference years ago.  I prefer a more laid back ambiance these days.  So your timing is everything when dining out at Tierney's.  No matter the time the food will be good.

data.title: Friday Night Family Gathering
data.text: We enjoyed a very good dinner Friday night at Tierney's.  The entertainment was enjoyable and the food was excellent.  People were great!

data.title: Great food, sub-par service
data.text:
I would have given this place an excellent rating, but our service was inefficient and at times frustrating.  We had reserved a table for 14 long in advance, and were given one server, who also was responsible for two other tables of 4.  Our drinks were delayed (including soft drinks) as they were short on cups.  We were seated at 7PM and our server didn't take our orders until 7:30 PM.  Ten minutes later, she came back, as she was confused about our orders.  She seemed harried the remainder of our meal.

But,...the food was excellent.  My wife's fried shrimp and my Chicken Pinot were great.  All of the others I asked also liked or loved their entrees.  Had I dined with a normal-sized group, I believe service would have appeared better.  So, I would suggest giving the place a try.

data.title: Unexpected
data.text: The menu is diverse and innovative. The food delicious. We were tempted to order a specialty cocktail, but had a long drive ahead of us. The filet on my jalapeño fish sandwich was perfectly crisp. It came with a lemon-mint chicken and rice soup that was wonderfully distinctive. My husband's chipotle bacon cheeseburger didn't disappoint. Order the sauce on the side so you can enjoy it with the deliciously fresh fries.

data.title: Excellent food and service
data.text: Very good food like homemade!  Service was very good we went for lunch great menu selection!   Burgers, chicken sandwiches which are around 9-12 dollars.  Breakfast runs from $6.00 to $9.00  opens at 5AM good breakfast done at least once a week to meet friend before work!

data.title: Great Breakfast!
data.text:
My wife and I traveled to Dallas to pick up a car and drive it back to Portland, OR.  We started our day with breakfast before picking up the car.  We were looking for something close to the dealership and I found Tierney's and it seemed to have some good ratings.

We sat down and were greeted by several people, a very warm welcome.  Quickly we had a drink order taken while we pondered what to order for food.  Honestly it was a hard choice as many things looked good on the menu.  We ended up with a the Texas Eggs Benedict and the "All American" breakfast.  We enjoyed our meal and since it was our first time to Texas, enjoyed the Texas Toast and gravy!  It was all very good and I would certainly eat there again if I was in the area!

data.title: family restaurant
data.text: I had a baby shower there, good service, good food, good time. Their outside patio is also a nice area to eat.

data.title: Meet and Eat...quiet or noisy!
data.text: A place for quiet or noise, depending on where you sit.  The food is the same: GOOD.  Great place to meet friends for lunch or dinner.

data.title: Most Awesome Chicken Pot Pie
data.text:
It's a Thursday special. GO ON THURSDAYS FOR THE CHICKEN POT PIE. This place does home-style cooking that can't be beat. Pies are good. Burgers are good. Salads are good.
It's all good but the CHICKEN POT PIE IS AWESOME.

data.title: Tasty comfort food
data.text: Interesting menu, all tasted fine, salads used freshly prepared ingredients, potato salad was different and included jalapeños, bacon and cheese similar to a loaded baked potato, but presented as a traditional potato salad.  The entree "Tierney salad" needed more salad dressing. The potato chip chicken was good comfort food, however, the sauce was advertised as an onion sauce, but needed more seasoning and onion flavor and perhaps some grilled or cartelized onions over the top.  The sauce was closer in  texture and flavor to the gravy used over chicken fried steak. Interesting atmosphere, however, the physical plant clearly needed some cleaning and maintenance in the entry area.  This would be a spot to return to, especially after work for drinks and a bite to eat.

data.title: Fantastic food
data.text: So many favorites, but the Potato Chip Chicken is out of this world. The Avocado Chicken Salad and the new Sesame Chicken Salad is delicious, especially in this hot weather. Very attentive staff, the management is amazing. And the steaks are delicious.

data.title: CAN YOU SAY HAPPY HOUR?!?!
data.text: This is my go to place for Happy Hour! Great prices.. $3 premium drinks, $5 appetizers $2 house drinks!! There were five of us.. We shared the Potato Chip Chicken strips (AMAZING!!) , Nachos, and Quesadillas. Drinks and food were great, as well as the service! I've been here a few times for lunch and dinner.. Everything on the menu is great! Be sure and try the homemade pies, delicious!!! I always have to take a slice home, because I can't save room.. The food is that delicious!

data.title: It is like being at home
data.text: I love Tierney's. The potatoes chip chicken and avocado salad are amazing!!! I can also pretty much guarantee whatever the pie of the day will be just as amazing. I have been here at night. I like the lights outside in patio; it is a great place to relax. Then, lunch with friends or family is always fun. The people are nice and warm, you always feel like mom is cooking for you.
